case.name: AXA Asia Pacific Holdings Limited v Commissioner of Taxation [2008] FCA 1834 (3 December 2008)

citphrases.citphrase: whether full input tax credits available to taxpayer
taxpayer acquired services in a taxable supply by way of a feasibility study as to whether it should acquire debts and recover them
taxpayer carrying on enterprise of acquiring debts and recovering them, acquisition of debts a financial supply
taxpayer also acquired services relating to recovery of debts
whether input credits disallowed as relating to the making of a financial supply (the acquisition of the debts) which would be input taxed

whether credits disallowed where acquisition of recovery services related to the financial supply (the acquisition of the debts) a new tax system (goods and services tax) act 1999 (cth), ss 11 -15(2)(a), 11 -5, 11 -20, div 132 a new tax system (goods and services tax) regulations 1999 (cth), regs 70-5.02, 40-5.09
debts purportedly assigned before tax payable
whether money due or accruing due to taxpayer
whether service of notice prevents such assignment

"losses and outgoings to the extent to &which they are incurred in gaining or producing the assessable income, or are necessarily incurred in carrying on a business for the purpose of gaining or producing such income"
mining operations in siam prior to war
income therefrom exempt from federal income tax
suspension of operations in siam during war
no income thereafter derived by company except small amount from investments
maintenance of office and central administration in melbourne
